usefulItems: loaf tin (30 cm x 12 cm x 10 cm), wire rack, oven
title: Five-seed bread

ingredients.content: 30 g extra virgin olive oil plus extra for greasing
30 g sesame seeds, plus extra for sprinkling
30 g linseeds, plus extra for sprinkling
30 g sunflower seeds, plus extra for sprinkling
30 g pumpkin seeds, plus extra for sprinkling
30 g poppy seeds, plus extra for sprinkling

preparations.content: Place water and yeast in mixing bowl and warm <b>2 min 30 sec/37°C/speed 2<b>. Meanwhile, grease a loaf tin (approx. 30 cm x 12 cm x 10 cm) and set aside.

Add bread flour, salt, rolled oats, sesame seeds, linseeds, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, poppy seeds, honey and extra virgin olive oil to mixing bowl and knead <b>2 min 30 sec/<b>. Dough will have a wet and sticky consistency (see tip).

Transfer dough to prepared loaf tin and sprinkle with extra sesame seeds, linseeds, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, and poppy seeds. Let rise uncovered in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 45-60 minutes). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 200°C.
Bake for 40-45 minutes (200°C). Allow to cool in tin for 5 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack and allow to cool before slicing.

hintsAndTricks: This dough is very sticky, but there is no need to add more flour as the wet dough produces a crunchy crust and moist crumb.
